techmeme.title: Nasscom-Zinnov: Indian tech startup funding surged 23% YoY to $7.4B in 2024, with the number of deals up 27% YoY and newly founded startups more than doubling (Moneycontrol)
Redpanda, which offers companies AI-powered data analytics tools, raised a $100M Series D led by GV, with participation from Lightspeed, at a $1B valuation (Katie Roof/Bloomberg)
Midjourney begins rolling out V7, its first new AI image model in nearly a year with a "totally different architecture", a week after OpenAI's new image tool (Kyle Wiggers/TechCrunch)
Meta antitrust case is the first major test of President Trump's FTC and its chair Andrew Ferguson, a Big Tech critic; Meta is exploring a possible settlement (Financial Times)
President Trump reiterates he's open to tariff relief for China if it approves the sale of TikTok's US operations; the app faces an April 5 divestment deadline (Annmarie Hordern/Bloomberg)
